visitingplace.name: Bombay High Court
visitingplace.description: It is one of the oldest High Courts of India with jurisdiction over the states of Maharashtra and Goa, and, the Union Territories of Daman and Diu and Dadra and Nagar Havel

visitingplace.name: Gate Way Of India
visitingplace.description: The Gateway of India is an arch monument built during the 20th century in Bombay, India.

visitingplace.name: Siddhivinayak Temple
visitingplace.description: The Shree Siddhivinayak Ganapati Mandir is a Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shri Ganesh.

visitingplace.name: Elephanta Caves
visitingplace.description: Elephanta Caves are a network of sculpted caves located on Elephanta Island, or Gharapuri in Mumbai Harbour, 10 kilometres to the east of the city of Mumbai in the Indian state of Maharashtra.

visitingplace.name: Athirappilly
visitingplace.description: Athirappilly is a first grade Grama Panchayath with 489.00 kmÂ² area in Chalakudy Taluk, Thrissur district in Kerala, India.

visitingplace.name: Vembanad
visitingplace.description: Vembanad is the longest lake in India, and the largest lake in the state of Kerala. It is also counted as one of the largest lakes in India.

visitingplace.name: Ponmudi
visitingplace.description: Ponmudi is a hill station in the Thiruvananthapuram District of Kerala in India.

visitingplace.name: Alleppey
visitingplace.description: Alappuzha (or Alleppey) is a city on the Laccadive Sea in the southern Indian state of Kerala. It's best known for houseboat cruises along the rustic Kerala backwaters, a network of tranquil canals and lagoons.
